metadata.title: CVE-2018-5848 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In the function wmi_set_ie(), the length validation code does not handleunsigned integer overflow properly. As a result, a large value of the'ie_len' argument can cause a buffer overflow in all Android releases fromCAF (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) using the LinuxKernel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5848` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-143-generic - 4.4.0-143.169
linux-image-4.4.0-143-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-143.169
linux-image-4.4.0-143-lowlatency - 4.4.0-143.169
linux-image-4.4.0-143-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-143.169
linux-image-4.4.0-143-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-143.169
linux-image-4.4.0-143-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-143.169
linux-image-4.4.0-143-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-143.169
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-143-generic - 4.4.0-143.169
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-143-lowlatency - 4.4.0-143.169
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1041-kvm - 4.4.0-1041.47
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1077-aws - 4.4.0-1077.87
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1055-azure - 4.15.0-1055.60
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1040-gcp - 4.15.0-1040.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-143.169').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1041.47').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1077.87').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1055.60').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1040.42~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1021.23~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1104.112').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1108.113').
